packages.name: PSWindowsUpdate - Install Specific Microsoft KB
packages.description:
This is a TEMPLATE package that REQUIRES YOU to make additional MODIFICATIONS to complete the package:
1. You will need to replace the KBNumber in the PARAMETERS field of STEP 1 with the KBNumber you wish to deploy.
2. Make sure you preserve the exact syntax as shown.
3. The KB will only install if it applies to the operating system.

Name: PSWindowsUpdate (WSUS Alternative)
Publisher: PowerShellGallery
Home: https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/PSWindowsUpdate/2.2.1.4
Download: https://psg-prod-eastus.azureedge.net/packages/pswindowsupdate.2.2.1.4.nupkg
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 10, 11, Server 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 32/64 bit
KB Article: https://help.pdq.com/hc/en-us/articles/13615858339611

While we typically avoid third-party tools, the PSWindowsUpdate module is well-known and widely used for checking and applying all available Microsoft updates to a machine and can be a viable alternative to WSUS. If you are a military or government organization, you may want to review this PowerShell Module in greater detail before placing into production to ensure that it meets your security standards.

1. Check if the NuGet Package Provider is installed. If it is not, it will attempt to download and install the Nuget Provider.
2. Check if the PSWindowsUpdate module is installed. If it is not, it will use the NuGet installer to attempt to download and install the PSWindowsUpdate module.
3. It will then check for any existing WSUS/Windows Update registry settings and back them up before removing them. (This is to avoid returning a partial list of available updates restricted by policies)
4. It will then run the PSWindowsUpdate module and check for all available Microsoft patches.
5. Then, depending on which of the 6 packages you've selected to run, it will install those updates.
6. Reboots are disabled, but may be required in order to complete the installation of some patches and properly reflect that packages have been successfully installed
7. Finally, it will look and if the registry did have existing WSUS/Windows update policies, it will restore those settings to honor the organization GPO/configuration.

*If the PowerShell script fails, the target computer may need you to run an additional command first to allow PowerShell scripts to run. You can create a custom package with a PowerShell step and paste this code in the PowerShell step:
Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Force
*This package will not work on air-gapped networks

Key: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Google\Update\Install{8A69D345-D564-463C-AFF1-A69D9E530F96}
Value = 0
This registry value is commonly found in organizations using Chrome GPOs.
Forcing this installation will result in uninstallation of the old Chrome package and
installation of the new Chrome package will fail with a resulting error 1603.
https://admx.help/?Category=GoogleUpdate&Policy=Google.Policies.Update::Pol_AllowInstallationGoogleChrome

If you want to enable auto-updates, you can still download Chrome as an auto-download package:
1. Add a Command step as a post-step
2. Copy and paste this line:
%SystemRoot%\System32\Reg.exe DELETE "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Google\Update" /v "Update{8A69D345-D564-463C-AFF1-A69D9E530F96}" /f
3. Save the package.

packages.name: Remote Desktop (Azure)
packages.description:
Publisher: Microsoft
Download: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/users/connect-windows
Supported Operating Systems: All
Supported Architecture: 32/64

The Microsoft Remote Desktop client is used to connect to Azure Virtual Desktop to access your desktops and applications.
1. The first time you subscribe to a workspace, from the Let's get started screen, select Subscribe or Subscribe with URL.
2. If you selected Subscribe, sign in with your user account when prompted, for example user@contoso.com. After a few seconds, your workspaces should show the desktops and applications that have been made available to you by your admin.
3. If you see the message No workspace is associated with this email address, your admin might not have set up email discovery, or you are using an Azure environment that is not Azure cloud. Try the steps to Subscribe with URL instead.
4. If you selected Subscribe with URL, in the Email or Workspace URL box, enter the relevant URL from the following table. After a few seconds, the message We found Workspaces at the following URLs should be displayed:
Azure cloud (most common): https://rdweb.wvd.microsoft.com
Azure for US Government: https://rdweb.wvd.azure.us/api/arm/feeddiscovery
Azure operated by 21Vianet: https://rdweb.wvd.azure.cn/api/arm/feeddiscovery
5. Sign in with your user account when prompted. After a few seconds, the workspace should show the desktops and applications that have been made available to you by your admin.

packages.name: Adobe Reader DC Patch (32-bit)
packages.description:
Publisher: Adobe
Download: https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/ReleaseNotesDC/index.html
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10, Server 2008R2, 2012, 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 32/64

Special Notes:
1. This only installs the 32-bit version of Adobe Reader DC. At this time we only provide a 32-bit installation for Adobe Reader DC due to complications with the unified 64-bit installer for Adobe Acrobat/Adobe Reader. Both installations for Adobe Acrobat DC 64-bit and Adobe Reader DC 64-bit are indistinguishable and this leads to a problem with identifying the applications with current collections as well as the potential for overwriting an older licensed version of Adobe Acrobat with the latest unlicensed (free) version Adobe Reader 64-bit.
https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/DesktopDeployment/singleinstaller.html
2. Target computers MUST have older version of Adobe Acrobat Reader DC MUI (Continuous Track)
3. If you recieve an error that the update does not apply, you may have the older Adobe Reader (Classic) version installed. If this is the case,
you'll want to run the full package Adober Reader DC (32-bit) to update to the latest Continuous (MUI) version. This patch will then work going forward.
4. Disables Auto Update, Adobe Upselling and Adobe Services.
5. Versions 15.023.20053 and higher come with the Adobe Acrobat extension for Chrome that are disabled in steps 8 and 9.

packages.name: Adobe Reader DC (32-bit)
packages.description:
Publisher: Adobe
Download: https://get.adobe.com/reader/enterprise/
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10, Server 2008R2, 2012, 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 32/64

Special Notes:
1. This only installs the 32-bit version of Adobe Reader DC. At this time we only provide a 32-bit installation for Adobe Reader DC due to complications with the unified 64-bit installer for Adobe Acrobat/Adobe Reader. Both installations for Adobe Acrobat DC 64-bit and Adobe Reader DC 64-bit are indistinguishable and this leads to a problem with identifying the applications with current collections as well as the potential for overwriting an older licensed version of Adobe Acrobat with the latest unlicensed (free) version Adobe Reader 64-bit.
https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/DesktopDeployment/singleinstaller.html
2. This is for New Installs ONLY. Use the Adobe Reader DC Patch to update existing installations
3. Uninstalls existing installations of Adobe Reader (Classic and Continuous).
4. Disables Auto Update, Adobe Upselling and Adobe Services.
5. Versions 15.023.20053 and higher come with the Adobe Acrobat extension for Chrome that are disabled in steps 8 and 9.

packages.name: Adobe AIR
packages.description:
Publisher: HARMAN International
Download: https://airsdk.harman.com/download

packages.name: Adobe Reader DC Patch (32-bit)
packages.description:
Publisher: Adobe
Download: https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/ReleaseNotesDC/index.html
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10, Server 2008R2, 2012, 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 32/64

Special Notes:
1. This only installs the 32-bit version of Adobe Reader DC. At this time we only provide a 32-bit installation for Adobe Reader DC due to complications with the unified 64-bit installer for Adobe Acrobat/Adobe Reader. Both installations for Adobe Acrobat DC 64-bit and Adobe Reader DC 64-bit are indistinguishable and this leads to a problem with identifying the applications with current collections as well as the potential for overwriting an older licensed version of Adobe Acrobat with the latest unlicensed (free) version Adobe Reader 64-bit.
https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/DesktopDeployment/singleinstaller.html
2. Target computers MUST have older version of Adobe Acrobat Reader DC MUI (Continuous Track)
3. If you recieve an error that the update does not apply, you may have the older Adobe Reader (Classic) version installed. If this is the case,
you'll want to run the full package Adober Reader DC (32-bit) to update to the latest Continuous (MUI) version. This patch will then work going forward.
4. Disables Auto Update, Adobe Upselling and Adobe Services.
5. Versions 15.023.20053 and higher come with the Adobe Acrobat extension for Chrome that are disabled in steps 8 and 9.

packages.name: Adobe Reader DC (32-bit)

https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/DesktopDeployment/singleinstaller.html
2. This is for New Installs ONLY. Use the Adobe Reader DC Patch to update existing installations
3. Uninstalls existing installations of Adobe Reader (Classic and Continuous).

Supported Architecture: 32/64

Custom Settings Applies:
1. Auto Update is disabled.
2. If you recive a deployment error on Step 1 or 2 due to Conditions, you should check this value on the endpoint:
Key: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Google\Update\Install{8A69D345-D564-463C-AFF1-A69D9E530F96}
Value = 0
This registry value is commonly found in organizations using Chrome GPOs.
Forcing this installation will result in uninstallation of the old Chrome package and
installation of the new Chrome package will fail with a resulting error 1603.
https://admx.help/?Category=GoogleUpdate&Policy=Google.Policies.Update::Pol_AllowInstallationGoogleChrome

If you want to enable auto-updates, you can still download Chrome as an auto-download package:
1. Add a Command step as a post-step
2. Copy and paste this line:
%SystemRoot%\System32\Reg.exe DELETE "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Google\Update" /v "Update{8A69D345-D564-463C-AFF1-A69D9E530F96}" /f
3. Save the package.

packages.name: Remote Desktop (Azure)
packages.description:
Publisher: Microsoft
Download: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/users/connect-windows
Supported Operating Systems: All
Supported Architecture: 32/64

The Microsoft Remote Desktop client is used to connect to Azure Virtual Desktop to access your desktops and applications.
1. The first time you subscribe to a workspace, from the Let's get started screen, select Subscribe or Subscribe with URL.
2. If you selected Subscribe, sign in with your user account when prompted, for example user@contoso.com. After a few seconds, your workspaces should show the desktops and applications that have been made available to you by your admin.
3. If you see the message No workspace is associated with this email address, your admin might not have set up email discovery, or you are using an Azure environment that is not Azure cloud. Try the steps to Subscribe with URL instead.
4. If you selected Subscribe with URL, in the Email or Workspace URL box, enter the relevant URL from the following table. After a few seconds, the message We found Workspaces at the following URLs should be displayed:
Azure cloud (most common): https://rdweb.wvd.microsoft.com
Azure for US Government: https://rdweb.wvd.azure.us/api/arm/feeddiscovery
Azure operated by 21Vianet: https://rdweb.wvd.azure.cn/api/arm/feeddiscovery
5. Sign in with your user account when prompted. After a few seconds, the workspace should show the desktops and applications that have been made available to you by your admin.

%SystemRoot%\System32\Reg.exe DELETE "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Google\Update" /v "Update{8A69D345-D564-463C-AFF1-A69D9E530F96}" /f
3. Save the package.

packages.name: Uninstall Adobe Reader
packages.description:
Publisher: PDQ.com
Download: https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/Labs/cleaner.html
Supported Operating Systems: All
Supported Architecture: 32/64

This will attempt to uninstall and remove all Adobe Acrobat and Reader from the target machine. Please test before running in your production environment.
WARNING: This may also remove trial and licensed versions of Adobe Acrobat due to a recent change with how Adobe installs the latest 64bit version of Reader and Acrobat:
https://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/about-acrobat-reader-dc-migration-to-64-bit.html

Removes Adobe Reader versions 9, X, XI, DC (2015), DC (2017), DC (2020), DC (Continuous Track). Targets may need to be rebooted.
/product =1 parameter will cause only Reader to be uninstalled. If this parameter is not specified then Adobe Acrobat will be uninstalled. Do not deploy to targets running Adobe Creative Suite.

Step 1: Stop Adobe Reader processes
Step 2: Removes Adobe Reader DC 2017, Adobe Reader DC 2020 and Adobe Reader DC
Step 3: Removes Acrobat DC 2021 (both Continuous and Classic)
Step 4: Removes Acrobat DC 2015 (both Continuous and Classic)
Step 5: Removes Reader X and XI
Step 6: Removes Reader 9

packages.name: Update Microsoft Office (and Enable Automatic Updating)
packages.description:
Publisher: PDQ
Supported Operating Systems: All
Supported Architecture: 32/64

This package will attempt to update Microsoft Office 2016, 2019, 2021, and 365
Using the Microsoft Office Click-To-Run* built-in updater (if found) in the following locations:
C:\Program Files\Common Files\microsoft shared\ClickToRun\OfficeC2RClient.exe"
C:\Program Files\Common Files (x86)\microsoft shared\ClickToRun\OfficeC2RClient.exe"

WARNING! This package will make changes** to your Office configurations! These changes will persist unless
you have GPOs in place to update/remove these settings.

This package will:
1. Check if Office Click-To-Run updater is installed
2. Enable Automatic Updates for Office
3. Set Automatic Updates to use the Current channel (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/updates/overview-update-channels)
4. Disable Menu option for users to Disable Automatic Updates
5. Run the Click-To-Run updater

*Microsoft Click-to-Run is a technology developed by Microsoft that allows users
to install and update Microsoft Office products over the internet. It provides a
streamlined and efficient way to manage Office installations and updates.

**Registry settings created/updated:
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\office\16.0\common\officeupdate\EnableAutomaticUpdates [1]
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\office\16.0\common\officeupdate\HideEnableDisableUpdates [1]
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\office\16.0\common\officeupdate\UpdateBranch [Current]
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\WOW6432Node\Policies\Microsoft\office\16.0\common\officeupdate\EnableAutomaticUpdates [1]HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\WOW6432Node\Policies\Microsoft\office\16.0\common\officeupdate\HideEnableDisableUpdates [1]
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\WOW6432Node\Policies\Microsoft\office\16.0\common\officeupdate\UpdateBranch [Current]

packages.name: Remote Desktop (Azure)
packages.description:
Publisher: Microsoft
Download: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/users/connect-windows
Supported Operating Systems: All
Supported Architecture: 32/64

The Microsoft Remote Desktop client is used to connect to Azure Virtual Desktop to access your desktops and applications.
1. The first time you subscribe to a workspace, from the Let's get started screen, select Subscribe or Subscribe with URL.
2. If you selected Subscribe, sign in with your user account when prompted, for example user@contoso.com. After a few seconds, your workspaces should show the desktops and applications that have been made available to you by your admin.
3. If you see the message No workspace is associated with this email address, your admin might not have set up email discovery, or you are using an Azure environment that is not Azure cloud. Try the steps to Subscribe with URL instead.
4. If you selected Subscribe with URL, in the Email or Workspace URL box, enter the relevant URL from the following table. After a few seconds, the message We found Workspaces at the following URLs should be displayed:
Azure cloud (most common): https://rdweb.wvd.microsoft.com
Azure for US Government: https://rdweb.wvd.azure.us/api/arm/feeddiscovery
Azure operated by 21Vianet: https://rdweb.wvd.azure.cn/api/arm/feeddiscovery
5. Sign in with your user account when prompted. After a few seconds, the workspace should show the desktops and applications that have been made available to you by your admin.

packages.name: Adobe Reader DC Patch (32-bit)
packages.description:
Publisher: Adobe
Download: https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/ReleaseNotesDC/index.html
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10, Server 2008R2, 2012, 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 32/64

Special Notes:
1. This only installs the 32-bit version of Adobe Reader DC. At this time we only provide a 32-bit installation for Adobe Reader DC due to complications with the unified 64-bit installer for Adobe Acrobat/Adobe Reader. Both installations for Adobe Acrobat DC 64-bit and Adobe Reader DC 64-bit are indistinguishable and this leads to a problem with identifying the applications with current collections as well as the potential for overwriting an older licensed version of Adobe Acrobat with the latest unlicensed (free) version Adobe Reader 64-bit.
https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/DesktopDeployment/singleinstaller.html
2. Target computers MUST have older version of Adobe Acrobat Reader DC MUI (Continuous Track)
3. If you recieve an error that the update does not apply, you may have the older Adobe Reader (Classic) version installed. If this is the case,
you'll want to run the full package Adober Reader DC (32-bit) to update to the latest Continuous (MUI) version. This patch will then work going forward.
4. Disables Auto Update, Adobe Upselling and Adobe Services.
5. Versions 15.023.20053 and higher come with the Adobe Acrobat extension for Chrome that are disabled in steps 8 and 9.

packages.name: Adobe Reader DC (32-bit)
packages.description:
Publisher: Adobe
Download: https://get.adobe.com/reader/enterprise/
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10, Server 2008R2, 2012, 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 32/64

Special Notes:
1. This only installs the 32-bit version of Adobe Reader DC. At this time we only provide a 32-bit installation for Adobe Reader DC due to complications with the unified 64-bit installer for Adobe Acrobat/Adobe Reader. Both installations for Adobe Acrobat DC 64-bit and Adobe Reader DC 64-bit are indistinguishable and this leads to a problem with identifying the applications with current collections as well as the potential for overwriting an older licensed version of Adobe Acrobat with the latest unlicensed (free) version Adobe Reader 64-bit.
https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/DesktopDeployment/singleinstaller.html
2. This is for New Installs ONLY. Use the Adobe Reader DC Patch to update existing installations
3. Uninstalls existing installations of Adobe Reader (Classic and Continuous).
4. Disables Auto Update, Adobe Upselling and Adobe Services.
5. Versions 15.023.20053 and higher come with the Adobe Acrobat extension for Chrome that are disabled in steps 8 and 9.

packages.name: VirtualBox
packages.description:
Publisher: Oracle
Download: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 10,11 / Server 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 64
The main installer is free to use for business under General Public License v3: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/GPLv3

There is also an extension pack that can be downloaded (from https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads), but it is
covered under a different license: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/VirtualBox_PUEL and
is only free for PERSONAL, EDUCATIONAL, or EVALUATION use. The best way to install the extension pack:
1. Download the latest extensions file that matches the version into your repository under the repository: $(Repository)\VirtualBox\7.0.18\Oracle_VM_VirtualBox_Extension_Pack-7.0.18.vbox-extpack
2. Create a Post-Step Command Step
3. Copy and paste this command into the Command Window:
ECHO y | START /WAIT "C:\Program Files\Oracle\VirtualBox\VBoxManage.exe" extpack install --replace "$(Repository)\VirtualBox\7.0.18\Oracle_VM_VirtualBox_Extension_Pack-7.0.18.vbox-extpack"
4. In the same Command Step under the Files section / Browse and attach the extensions file: $(Repository)\VirtualBox\7.0.18\Oracle_VM_VirtualBox_Extension_Pack-7.0.18.vbox-extpack
5. Save the package and deploy

packages.description:

Special Notes:
1. This only installs the 32-bit version of Adobe Reader DC. At this time we only provide a 32-bit installation for Adobe Reader DC due to complications with the unified 64-bit installer for Adobe Acrobat/Adobe Reader. Both installations for Adobe Acrobat DC 64-bit and Adobe Reader DC 64-bit are indistinguishable and this leads to a problem with identifying the applications with current collections as well as the potential for overwriting an older licensed version of Adobe Acrobat with the latest unlicensed (free) version Adobe Reader 64-bit.
https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/DesktopDeployment/singleinstaller.html
2. Target computers MUST have older version of Adobe Acrobat Reader DC MUI (Continuous Track)
3. If you recieve an error that the update does not apply, you may have the older Adobe Reader (Classic) version installed. If this is the case,
you'll want to run the full package Adober Reader DC (32-bit) to update to the latest Continuous (MUI) version. This patch will then work going forward.
4. Disables Auto Update, Adobe Upselling and Adobe Services.
5. Versions 15.023.20053 and higher come with the Adobe Acrobat extension for Chrome that are disabled in steps 8 and 9.

packages.name: Adobe Reader DC (32-bit)

Both installations for Adobe Acrobat DC 64-bit and Adobe Reader DC 64-bit are indistinguishable and this leads to a problem with identifying the applications with current collections as well as the potential for overwriting an older licensed version of Adobe Acrobat with the latest unlicensed (free) version Adobe Reader 64-bit.
https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/DesktopDeployment/singleinstaller.html
2. This is for New Installs ONLY. Use the Adobe Reader DC Patch to update existing installations
3. Uninstalls existing installations of Adobe Reader (Classic and Continuous).

packages.name: VirtualBox
packages.description:
Publisher: Oracle
Download: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 10,11 / Server 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 64
The main installer is free to use for business under General Public License v3: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/GPLv3

There is also an extension pack that can be downloaded (from https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads), but it is
covered under a different license: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/VirtualBox_PUEL and
is only free for PERSONAL, EDUCATIONAL, or EVALUATION use. The best way to install the extension pack:
1. Download the latest extensions file that matches the version into your repository under the repository: $(Repository)\VirtualBox\7.0.10\Oracle_VM_VirtualBox_Extension_Pack-7.0.10.vbox-extpack
2. Create a Post-Step Command Step
3. Copy and paste this command into the Command Window:
ECHO y | START /WAIT "C:\Program Files\Oracle\VirtualBox\VBoxManage.exe" extpack install --replace "$(Repository)\VirtualBox\7.0.10\Oracle_VM_VirtualBox_Extension_Pack-7.0.10.vbox-extpack"
4. In the same Command Step under the Files section / Browse and attach the extensions file: $(Repository)\VirtualBox\7.0.10\Oracle_VM_VirtualBox_Extension_Pack-7.0.10.vbox-extpack
5. Save the package and deploy

packages.name: Uninstall Adobe Reader
packages.description:
Adobe Reader Cleaner

WARNING: This may also remove trial and licensed versions of Adobe Acrobat due to a recent change with how Adobe installs the latest 64bit version of Reader and Acrobat:
https://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/about-acrobat-reader-dc-migration-to-64-bit.html

Removes Adobe Reader versions 9, X, XI, DC (2015), DC (2017), DC (2020), DC (Continuous Track). Targets may need to be rebooted.
/product =1 parameter will cause only Reader to be uninstalled. If this parameter is not specified then Adobe Acrobat will be uninstalled. Do not deploy to targets running Adobe Creative Suite.

Step 1: Stop Adobe Reader processes
Step 2: Removes Adobe Reader DC 2017, Adobe Reader DC 2020 and Adobe Reader DC
Step 3: Removes Acrobat DC 2021 (both Continuous and Classic)
Step 4: Removes Acrobat DC 2015 (both Continuous and Classic)
Step 5: Removes Reader X and XI
Step 6: Removes Reader 9

packages.name: VirtualBox
packages.description:
Publisher: Oracle
Download: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 10,11 / Server 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 64
The main installer is free to use for business under General Public License v3: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/GPLv3

There is also an extension pack that can be downloaded (from https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads), but it is
covered under a different license: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/VirtualBox_PUEL and
is only free for PERSONAL, EDUCATIONAL, or EVALUATION use. The best way to install the extension pack:
1. Download the latest extensions file that matches the version into your repository under the repository: $(Repository)\VirtualBox\7.0.14\Oracle_VM_VirtualBox_Extension_Pack-7.0.14.vbox-extpack
2. Create a Post-Step Command Step
3. Copy and paste this command into the Command Window:
ECHO y | START /WAIT "C:\Program Files\Oracle\VirtualBox\VBoxManage.exe" extpack install --replace "$(Repository)\VirtualBox\7.0.14\Oracle_VM_VirtualBox_Extension_Pack-7.0.14.vbox-extpack"
4. In the same Command Step under the Files section / Browse and attach the extensions file: $(Repository)\VirtualBox\7.0.14\Oracle_VM_VirtualBox_Extension_Pack-7.0.14.vbox-extpack
5. Save the package and deploy

packages.name: Adobe Reader DC (32-bit)
packages.description:
Publisher: Adobe
Download: https://get.adobe.com/reader/enterprise/
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10, Server 2008R2, 2012, 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 32/64

Special Notes:
1. This only installs the 32-bit version of Adobe Reader DC. At this time we only provide a 32-bit installation for Adobe Reader DC due to complications with the unified 64-bit installer for Adobe Acrobat/Adobe Reader. Both installations for Adobe Acrobat DC 64-bit and Adobe Reader DC 64-bit are indistinguishable and this leads to a problem with identifying the applications with current collections as well as the potential for overwriting an older licensed version of Adobe Acrobat with the latest unlicensed (free) version Adobe Reader 64-bit.
https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/DesktopDeployment/singleinstaller.html
2. This is for New Installs ONLY. Use the Adobe Reader DC Patch to update existing installations
3. Uninstalls existing installations of Adobe Reader (Classic and Continuous).
4. Disables Auto Update, Adobe Upselling and Adobe Services.
5. Versions 15.023.20053 and higher come with the Adobe Acrobat extension for Chrome that are disabled in steps 8 and 9.

packages.name: Adobe Reader DC Patch (32-bit)
packages.description:
Publisher: Adobe
Download: https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/ReleaseNotesDC/index.html
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10, Server 2008R2, 2012, 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 32/64

Special Notes:
1. This only installs the 32-bit version of Adobe Reader DC. At this time we only provide a 32-bit installation for Adobe Reader DC due to complications with the unified 64-bit installer for Adobe Acrobat/Adobe Reader. Both installations for Adobe Acrobat DC 64-bit and Adobe Reader DC 64-bit are indistinguishable and this leads to a problem with identifying the applications with current collections as well as the potential for overwriting an older licensed version of Adobe Acrobat with the latest unlicensed (free) version Adobe Reader 64-bit.
https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/DesktopDeployment/singleinstaller.html
2. Target computers MUST have older version of Adobe Acrobat Reader DC MUI (Continuous Track)
3. If you recieve an error that the update does not apply, you may have the older Adobe Reader (Classic) version installed. If this is the case,

1. This only installs the 32-bit version of Adobe Reader DC. At this time we only provide a 32-bit installation for Adobe Reader DC due to complications with the unified 64-bit installer for Adobe Acrobat/Adobe Reader. Both installations for Adobe Acrobat DC 64-bit and Adobe Reader DC 64-bit are indistinguishable and this leads to a problem with identifying the applications with current collections as well as the potential for overwriting an older licensed version of Adobe Acrobat with the latest unlicensed (free) version Adobe Reader 64-bit.
https://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/DesktopDeployment/singleinstaller.html
2. This is for New Installs ONLY. Use the Adobe Reader DC Patch to update existing installations
3. Uninstalls existing installations of Adobe Reader (Classic and Continuous).
4. Disables Auto Update, Adobe Upselling and Adobe Services.
5. Versions 15.023.20053 and higher come with the Adobe Acrobat extension for Chrome that are disabled in steps 8 and 9.

packages.name: VirtualBox
packages.description:
Publisher: Oracle
Download: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 10,11 / Server 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 64
The main installer is free to use for business under General Public License v3: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/GPLv3

There is also an extension pack that can be downloaded (from https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads), but it is
covered under a different license: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/VirtualBox_PUEL and
is only free for PERSONAL, EDUCATIONAL, or EVALUATION use. The best way to install the extension pack:
1. Download the latest extensions file that matches the version into your repository under the repository: $(Repository)\VirtualBox\7.0.16\Oracle_VM_VirtualBox_Extension_Pack-7.0.16.vbox-extpack
2. Create a Post-Step Command Step
3. Copy and paste this command into the Command Window:
ECHO y | START /WAIT "C:\Program Files\Oracle\VirtualBox\VBoxManage.exe" extpack install --replace "$(Repository)\VirtualBox\7.0.16\Oracle_VM_VirtualBox_Extension_Pack-7.0.16.vbox-extpack"
4. In the same Command Step under the Files section / Browse and attach the extensions file: $(Repository)\VirtualBox\7.0.16\Oracle_VM_VirtualBox_Extension_Pack-7.0.16.vbox-extpack
5. Save the package and deploy

packages.name: PSWindowsUpdate - Install Applicable Feature Updates from Microsoft
packages.description:
Name: PSWindowsUpdate (WSUS Alternative)
Publisher: PowerShellGallery
Home: https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/PSWindowsUpdate/2.2.1.4
Download: https://psg-prod-eastus.azureedge.net/packages/pswindowsupdate.2.2.1.4.nupkg
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 10, 11, Server 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 32/64 bit
KB Article: https://help.pdq.com/hc/en-us/articles/13615858339611

While we typically avoid third-party tools, the PSWindowsUpdate module is well-known and widely used for checking and applying all available Microsoft updates to a machine and can be a viable alternative to WSUS. If you are a military or government organization, you may want to review this PowerShell Module in greater detail before placing into production to ensure that it meets your security standards.

1. Check if the NuGet Package Provider is installed. If it is not, it will attempt to download and install the Nuget Provider.
2. Check if the PSWindowsUpdate module is installed. If it is not, it will use the NuGet installer to attempt to download and install the PSWindowsUpdate module.
3. It will then check for any existing WSUS/Windows Update registry settings and back them up before removing them. (This is to avoid returning a partial list of available updates restricted by policies)
4. It will then run the PSWindowsUpdate module and check for all available Microsoft patches.
5. Then, depending on which of the 6 packages you've selected to run, it will install those updates.
6. Reboots are disabled, but may be required in order to complete the installation of some patches and properly reflect that packages have been successfully installed
7. Finally, it will look and if the registry did have existing WSUS/Windows update policies, it will restore those settings to honor the organization GPO/configuration.

*If the PowerShell script fails, the target computer may need you to run an additional command first to allow PowerShell scripts to run. You can create a custom package with a PowerShell step and paste this code in the PowerShell step:
Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Force
*This package will not work on air-gapped networks

packages.name: PSWindowsUpdate - Get All Applicable Updates from Microsoft (Audit Only)
packages.description:
Name: PSWindowsUpdate (WSUS Alternative)
Publisher: PowerShellGallery
Home: https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/PSWindowsUpdate/2.2.1.4
Download: https://psg-prod-eastus.azureedge.net/packages/pswindowsupdate.2.2.1.4.nupkg
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 10, 11, Server 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 32/64 bit
KB Article: https://help.pdq.com/hc/en-us/articles/13615858339611

While we typically avoid third-party tools, the PSWindowsUpdate module is well-known and widely used for checking and applying all available Microsoft updates to a machine and can be a viable alternative to WSUS. If you are a military or government organization, you may want to review this PowerShell Module in greater detail before placing into production to ensure that it meets your security standards.

1. Check if the NuGet Package Provider is installed. If it is not, it will attempt to download and install the Nuget Provider.
2. Check if the PSWindowsUpdate module is installed. If it is not, it will use the NuGet installer to attempt to download and install the PSWindowsUpdate module.
3. It will then check for any existing WSUS/Windows Update registry settings and back them up before removing them. (This is to avoid returning a partial list of available updates restricted by policies)
4. It will then run the PSWindowsUpdate module and check for all available Microsoft patches.
5. You can see what updates apply to the target by looking in the output log after deployment.
6. Reboots are disabled, but may be required in order to complete the installation of some patches and properly reflect that packages have been successfully installed
7. Finally, it will look and if the registry did have existing WSUS/Windows update policies, it will restore those settings to honor the organization GPO/configuration.

To extend this audit functionality for PDQ Inventory users, there are 3 additional files that have been bundled with this package.
Once the package is downloaded, You can find them here:
$(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryScanner_GetAllApplicableUpdates.ps1
$(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryScanner_GetApplicableMicrosoftUpdates.xml
$(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryReport_GetApplicableMicrosoftUpdates.xml

1. Open PDQ Inventory / Right-click on Scan Profiles and choose Import.
Navigate to $(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryScanner_GetApplicableMicrosoftUpdates.xml and choose Open.
(If you require signed PowerShell scripts in your environment, you will need to edit the scanner you just imported and instead of the included script, you will need to change to File and browse to the signed PowerShell script $(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryScanner_GetAllApplicableUpdates.ps1.)
2. You can now right-click and Scan Computers or Scan Collection with the newly imported Get Applicable Microsoft Updates scanner
3. You can view the results of these scans by opening a computer's inventory /clicking on the PowerShell section, then choosing PowerShell (Get Applicable Microsoft Updates) from the drop-down box.
Available updates will appear or you may notice a single entry indicating there are currently no applicable updates.
4. Open PDQ Inventory / Right-click on Reports and choose Import. Navigate to $(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryReport_GetApplicableMicrosoftUpdates.xml and choose Open. You can now open and run Get Applicable Updates from Microsoft. This will report on all machines that you have scanned with the Get Applicable Microsoft Updates scanner (Step 2)

*If the PowerShell script fails, the target computer may need you to run an additional command first to allow PowerShell scripts to run. You can create a custom package with a PowerShell step and paste this code in the PowerShell step:
Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Force
*This package will not work on air-gapped networks

WARNING! DO NOT open a Deploy or Inventory database that is currently running. You will cause corruption and
potentially stop your PDQ server from running correctly. If you want to view the data, you must first close all PDQ instances,
stop both PDQDeploy and PDQInventory services, create a copy of the databases, and then view the copied databases with
DB Browser.

packages.name: PSWindowsUpdate - Get All Applicable Updates from Microsoft (Audit Only)
packages.description:
Name: PSWindowsUpdate (WSUS Alternative)
Publisher: PowerShellGallery
Home: https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/PSWindowsUpdate/2.2.0.3
Download: https://psg-prod-eastus.azureedge.net/packages/pswindowsupdate.2.2.0.3.nupkg
VirusTotal: https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/29b510ec19c8c8796ecf762f11a852143878c64ca76c7606764df428677a9d0a
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 10, 11, Server 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 32/64 bit
KB Article: https://help.pdq.com/hc/en-us/articles/13615858339611

While we typically avoid third-party tools, the PSWindowsUpdate module is well-known and widely used for checking and applying all available Microsoft updates to a machine and can be a viable alternative to WSUS. If you are a military or government organization, you may want to review this PowerShell Module in greater detail before placing into production to ensure that it meets your security standards.

1. This package will download the NuGet Installer
2. Install the third-party PowerShell module: PSWindowsUpdate
3. Run the module and find all applicable Microsoft Updates (Audit)
4. You can see what updates apply to the target by looking in the output log after deployment.
5. To extend this audit functionality for PDQ Inventory users, there are 3 additional files that have been downloaded with this package:
$(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryScanner_GetAllApplicableUpdates.ps1
$(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryScanner_GetApplicableMicrosoftUpdates.xml
$(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryReport_GetApplicableMicrosoftUpdates.xml
6. Open PDQ Inventory / Right-click on Scan Profiles and choose Import. Navigate to $(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryScanner_GetApplicableMicrosoftUpdates.xml and choose Open.
(If you require signed PowerShell scripts in your environment, you will need to edit the scanner you just imported and instead of the included script, you will need to change to File and browse to the signed PowerShell script $(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryScanner_GetAllApplicableUpdates.ps1.)
7. Open PDQ Inventory / Right-click on Reports and choose Import. Navigate to $(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryReport_GetApplicableMicrosoftUpdates.xml and choose Open
8. You can now right-click and Scan Computers or Scan Collection with the newly imported Get Applicable Microsoft Updates scanner
9. You can view the results of these scans by opening a computer's inventory /clicking on the PowerShell section, then choosing PowerShell (Get Applicable Microsoft Updates) from the drop-down box.
Available updates will appear or you may notice a single entry indicating there are currently no applicable updates.
10. Additionally, if you return to the Inventory home screen and click on Reports, you can open and run Get Applicable Updates from Microsoft. This will report on all machines that you have scanned with the Get Applicable Microsoft Updates scanner (Step 8)

*If the PowerShell script fails, the target computer may need you to run an additional command first to allow PowerShell scripts to run. You can create a custom package with a PowerShell step and paste this code in the PowerShell step:
Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Force
*This package will not work on air-gapped networks

packages.name: TightVNC
packages.description:
Publisher: GlavSoft LLC
Download: https://www.tightvnc.com/download.php
Supported Operating Systems: All
Supported Architecture: 32/64
Special Notes:
1) Installs "server" portion only. Does NOT install the TightVNC Viewer on targets.

Custom Settings Applied:
1) Default remote control password is helpdesk
To change remote control password modify the VALUE_OF_PASSWORD=helpdesk parameter in the Install TightVNC steps AND the password in the Set TightVNC Password step.
TightVNC passwords must be eight (8) characters or fewer.
The step "Set TightVNC Password" runs since some targets do not process the VALUE_OF_PASSWORD property in the Install steps.

Dependencies:
1) PowerShell version 2 or higher is required to run Step 13.
2) This package will install the Mirage driver on Windows 7 and Server 2008 R2. While the driver appears to work on later OSes the vendor does not list any OS beyond Windows 7 as being supported.
The step "Install DFMirage Driver" will only run on supported OSes that do not have the driver software already installed.

While we typically avoid third-party tools, the PSWindowsUpdate module is well-known and widely used for checking and applying all available Microsoft updates to a machine and can be a viable alternative to WSUS. If you are a military or government organization, you may want to review this PowerShell Module in greater detail before placing into production to ensure that it meets your security standards.

1. This package will download the NuGet Installer
2. Install the third-party PowerShell module: PSWindowsUpdate
3. Run the module and install Microsoft Updates
4. A reboot may be required to complete installation

*If the PowerShell script fails, the target computer may need you to run an additional command first to allow PowerShell scripts to run. You can create a custom package with a PowerShell step and paste this code in the PowerShell step:
Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Force
*This package will not work on air-gapped networks

packages.name: PSWindowsUpdate - Get All Applicable Updates from Microsoft (Audit Only)
packages.description:
Name: PSWindowsUpdate (WSUS Alternative)
Publisher: PowerShellGallery
Home: https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/PSWindowsUpdate/2.2.0.3
Download: https://psg-prod-eastus.azureedge.net/packages/pswindowsupdate.2.2.0.3.nupkg
VirusTotal: https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/29b510ec19c8c8796ecf762f11a852143878c64ca76c7606764df428677a9d0a
Supported Operating Systems: Windows 10, 11, Server 2016, 2019, 2022
Supported Architecture: 32/64 bit
KB Article: https://help.pdq.com/hc/en-us/articles/13615858339611

While we typically avoid third-party tools, the PSWindowsUpdate module is well-known and widely used for checking and applying all available Microsoft updates to a machine and can be a viable alternative to WSUS. If you are a military or government organization, you may want to review this PowerShell Module in greater detail before placing into production to ensure that it meets your security standards.

1. This package will download the NuGet Installer
2. Install the third-party PowerShell module: PSWindowsUpdate
3. Run the module and find all applicable Microsoft Updates (Audit)
4. You can see what updates apply to the target by looking in the output log after deployment.
5. To extend this audit functionality for PDQ Inventory users, there are 2 additional XML files that have been downloaded with this package:
$(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryScanner_GetApplicableMicrosoftUpdates.xml
$(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryReport_GetApplicableMicrosoftUpdates.xml
(The default path for $(Repository) is typically: C:\Users\Public\Documents\Admin Arsenal\PDQ Deploy\Repository)
6. Open PDQ Inventory / Right-click on Scan Profiles and choose Import. Navigate to $(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryScanner_GetApplicableMicrosoftUpdates.xml and choose Open
7. Open PDQ Inventory / Right-click on Reports and choose Import. Navigate to $(Repository)\PSWindowsUpdate\InventoryReport_GetApplicableMicrosoftUpdates.xml and choose Open
8. You can now right-click and Scan Computers or Scan Collection with the newly imported Get Applicable Microsoft Updates scanner
9. You can view the results of these scans by opening a computer's inventory /clicking on the PowerShell section, then choosing PowerShell (Get Applicable Microsoft Updates) from the drop-down box.
Available updates will appear or you may notice an empty screen if there are currently no applicable updates.
10. Additionally, if you return to the Inventory home screen and click on Reports, you can open and run Get Applicable Updates from Microsoft.
This will report on all machines that you have scanned with the Get Applicable Microsoft Updates scanner (Step 8)

*If the PowerShell script fails, the target computer may need you to run an additional command first to allow PowerShell scripts to run. You can create a custom package with a PowerShell step and paste this code in the PowerShell step:
Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Force
*This package will not work on air-gapped networks

packages.name: TightVNC
packages.description:
Publisher: GlavSoft LLC
Download: https://www.tightvnc.com/download.php
Supported Operating Systems: All
Supported Architecture: 32/64
Special Notes:
1) Installs "server" portion only. Does NOT install the TightVNC Viewer on targets.

Custom Settings Applied:
1) Default remote control password is helpdesk
To change remote control password modify the VALUE_OF_PASSWORD=helpdesk parameter in the Install TightVNC steps AND the password in the Set TightVNC Password step.
TightVNC passwords must be eight (8) characters or fewer.
The step "Set TightVNC Password" runs since some targets do not process the VALUE_OF_PASSWORD property in the Install steps.

Dependencies:
1) PowerShell version 2 or higher is required to run Step 13.
2) This package will install the Mirage driver on Windows 7 and Server 2008 R2. While the driver appears to work on later OSes the vendor does not list any OS beyond Windows 7 as being supported.
The step "Install DFMirage Driver" will only run on supported OSes that do not have the driver software already installed.

packages.name: TEMPLATE - Office 2013 / Office 2016
packages.description:
This is a TEMPLATE package that REQUIRES YOU to make additional MODIFICATIONS to complete the package: A template package contains the framework for a package, but removes the actual installation\configuration files to comply with EULA restrictions regarding licensing and redistribution.
Reference: hthttps://help.pdq.com/hc/en-us/articles/4414751901851-PDQ-Package-Templates

Name: Office 2013, Office 2016
Publisher: Microsoft
Supported Operating Systems: Win 8.1, 10, Server 2016, 2019
Supported Architecture: 32/64

Full Instructions: https://help.pdq.com/hc/en-us/articles/4414536983963-TEMPLATE-Office-2013-Office-2016
1. You'll need to download the Office 2013 or 2016 ISO that you are licensed for and unpack the contents to your PDQ Repository location. Let's use: C:\Users\Public\Documents\Admin Arsenal\PDQ Deploy\Repository\PDQTemplates\Office2016
2. Now go to Start / Run and launch the Office Customization Tool:
"C:\Users\Public\Documents\Admin Arsenal\PDQ Deploy\Repository\PDQTemplates\Office2016\setup.exe" /admin
3. Use this article as a guide for configuring options: https://www.pdq.com/blog/silently-install-office-2016/
4. Once complete, save your file as C:\Users\Public\Documents\Admin Arsenal\PDQ Deploy\Repository\PDQTemplates\Office2016\Office2016ProPlus32.msp OR you can name this something different, but you will need to update the filename within the install step.
5. Now examine the install step in the package and ensure that the paths\filenames are correct with no yellow warning icons.
6. Test deploying the package to a few clients and confirm proper installation.

packages.name: TEMPLATE - Office 365 / Office 2019 / Office 2021
packages.description:
This is a TEMPLATE package that REQUIRES YOU to make additional MODIFICATIONS to complete the package: A template package contains the framework for a package, but removes the actual installation\configuration files to comply with EULA restrictions regarding licensing and redistribution.
Reference: https://help.pdq.com/hc/en-us/articles/4414751901851-PDQ-Package-Templates

Name: Office 365, Office 2019
Publisher: Microsoft
Supported Operating Systems: Win 8.1, 10, Server 2016, 2019
Supported Architecture: 32/64

Full Instructions: https://help.pdq.com/hc/en-us/articles/4414541384987-TEMPLATE-Office-365-Office-2019
1. Download the Office Deployment Tool: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=49117
2. Run the downloaded file and OVERWRITE all files in C:\Users\Public\Documents\Admin Arsenal\PDQ Deploy\Repository\PDQTemplates\Office365
3. Open a browser and launch the Office Customization Tool: https://config.office.com/deploymentsettings
4. Choose if you want a 32Bit or 64Bit installation.
5. Choose the correct Office 365 or 2019 version that is licensed for your organization.
6. IMPORTANT: Choose Office Content Delivery Network (CDN) for a Click-To-Run installation OR Choose Local Source if you want to host the installation files and set the path to: C:\Users\Public\Documents\Admin Arsenal\PDQ Deploy\Repository\PDQTemplates\Office365 (Or your chosen network repository location)
7. Make sure to set Show Installation to User to OFF
8. Export your CONFIGURATION.XML file and OVERWRITE the existing file in C:\Users\Public\Documents\Admin Arsenal\PDQ Deploy\Repository\PDQTemplates\Office365\
9. IF YOU CHOSE LOCAL SOURCE in your configuration, then open an elevated PowerShell window and run the following command:
C:\Users\Public\Documents\Admin Arsenal\PDQ Deploy\Repository\PDQTemplates\Office365\setup.exe /download configuration.xml Then WAIT. It will take some time to download. (You can SKIP this step if you chose Office Content Delivery Network (CDN))
10. Now examine the install step in the package and ensure that the paths\filenames are correct with no yellow warning icons.
11. Test deploying the package to a few clients and confirm proper installation.

Sample configuration.xml file:

















Additional Reference: https://www.pdq.com/blog/deploying-office-365-the-right-way/

packages.name: ShareX
packages.description:
Publisher: ShareX Team
Download: https://getsharex.com/downloads/
Supported Operating Systems: All
Supported Architecture: 32/64

Dependencies:
Requires .NET 4.6.2 or higher.

Special Notes:
1) To have ShareX start automatically: have user open ShareX, go to Application Settings > Integration and enable the "Run ShareX when Windows starts" checkbox.
2) The previous settings are backed up: "C:\Users\$USER\Documents\ShareX\Backup"
3) This application may conflict with hotkey assignments in other screen capture applications such as Greenshot.
4) When upgrading from versions before 12.0.0 the following settings will be reset to default:
Image effect settings
Authentication settings for paste.ee
Authentication settings for Flickr

packages.name: Autodesk DWG TrueView 2022
packages.description:
This desktop software enables you to view .dwg files and includes DWG TrueConvert software, which lets you convert newer .dwg files to work with older versions of AutoCAD.
http://www.autodesk.com/products/dwg/viewers

Notes:
-Step 1 checks if there are pending reboots from windows update. If there are, the package will fail and the target machine will need to be rebooted. Without this the DWG installer will reboot the target machine and fail to install.
-This will not upgrade or uninstall previous versions of Autodesk DWG TrueView.
-This deployment will cause approximately 800 MB of data to cross your network per target. This deployment may take a long time to complete. The default timeout has been increased to two hours.
-Target requirements: .NET 4.8 or later, 64-bit versions of Windows 10 1803 or higher.
https://knowledge.autodesk.com/support/dwg-trueview/learn-explore/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/System-requirements-for-Autodesk-DWG-TrueView-2022.html

Note: Autodesk no longer supports offline activation for 2021 products and later.

packages.name: TightVNC
packages.description:
Publisher: GlavSoft LLC
Download: https://www.tightvnc.com/download.php
Supported Operating Systems: All
Supported Architecture: 32/64
Special Notes:
1) Installs "server" portion only. Does NOT install the TightVNC Viewer on targets.

Custom Settings Applied:
1) Default remote control password is helpdesk
To change remote control password modify the VALUE_OF_PASSWORD=helpdesk parameter in the Install TightVNC steps AND the password in the Set TightVNC Password step.
TightVNC passwords must be eight (8) characters or fewer.
The step "Set TightVNC Password" runs since some targets do not process the VALUE_OF_PASSWORD property in the Install steps.

Dependencies:
1) PowerShell version 2 or higher is required to run Step 13.
2) This package will install the Mirage driver on Windows 7 and Server 2008 R2. While the driver appears to work on later OSes the vendor does not list any OS beyond Windows 7 as being supported.
The step "Install DFMirage Driver" will only run on supported OSes that do not have the driver software already installed.

packages.name: Windows 10 (1803) - Cumulative Update (32-bit)
packages.description:

A reboot is required but will not be initiated by this deployment, however depending on your environment Windows Update may reboot the computer.

This update can only be applied to Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education editions. This update isn't applicable to Windows 10 Pro or Windows 10 Home editions and won't install.

In addition to installing the latest cumulative update, this package will install the latest prerequisite servicing stack update for Windows 10 1803. Without this update, the cumulative update may not install.

packages.name: Uninstall Java 8

Uninstalls Java 8 and all updates (JRE and JDK).

This package will:
- kill running Java processes
- kill running browsers (IE and Firefox)
- kill running msiexec processes
- uninstall all versions of Java 8
- delete leftover registry keys and folders from previous Java installations

This package will not:
- stop Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, or Opera browsers (since these don't support the Java plugin).
- remove other major versions of Java besides Java 8
- remove other builds of Java, such as AdoptOpenJDK or Amazon Corretto

** This update can be applied to Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education editions only. This update isn't applicable to Windows 10 Pro or Windows 10 Home editions and won't install.

Attempting to install the update on a Pro version of Windows 10 1511 will result in the message "Update does not apply" with return code -2145124329.

packages.description:
Installs Cumulative Update on Windows 10 1511 Enterprise and Education version.

Per Microsoft's note on the KB details page, this update can be applied to Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education editions only. This update isn't applicable to Windows 10 Pro or Windows 10 Home editions and won't install.
Attempting to install the update on a Pro version of Windows 10 1511 will result in the message "Update does not apply" with return code -2145124329.

Does not update other releases of Windows 10 such as 1703, 1607, or the Initial (RTM) release.
A reboot is required but will not be initiated by this deployment, however depending on your environment Windows Update may reboot the computer.

Microsoft has listed known issues for this update. Please see the links below for more details.

Meltdown (CVE-2017-5754) specific information:
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/4072699/

KB4074591
https://support.microsoft.com/kb/4074591

If your computers are running Windows 10 1511 then Microsoft recommends that you perform an OS upgrade to the latest release of Windows 10.
